misuse: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
vulnerable_code:
SecureRandom random = new SecureRandom();
String defaultKey = String.valueOf(random.ints());
description: The code uses the SecureRandom class to generate a random number and then converts it to a string using the valueOf() method. This approach does not provide a sufficiently random value for cryptographic use.
recommendation: Use a more secure method to generate a random key, such as SecureRandom.nextBytes() or a cryptographically secure pseudo-random number generator (CSPRNG).
